page.title: 11Industry - Harborne
page.content: There is very little industry in Harborne - only a few tucked away out of sight in the back streets. We went to F.S. Walters and Sons in Clarence Road. The firm started in 1959 in Aston & moved to Harborne in 1963, into a building which had been used by an organ maker. Mr Walters is now retired & the firm is run by the sons. Eight years ago they had twelve workers now they only have three and one office worker. They make metal staircases, iron railings, gates, panels & central heating ducts. They work with mild steel, copper, aluminium & stainless steel & sell their product to builders & to other companies. They use a forge, guillotines, a roller, power saws & drills & many hand tools.
